channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: インディペンデント紙、ベルファスト・テレグラフ紙など100紙以上の新聞を所有したアイルランド有数の実業家、トニー・オライリー氏が短い闘病生活の末88歳で死去（BBC）。
item.description:
BBC:
Tony O'Reilly, one of Ireland's leading businessmen, who had owned the Independent, Belfast Telegraph, and over 100 newspapers, dies at 88 after a short illness  —  Tony O'Reilly, the former owner of the Independent and Belfast Telegraph newspapers, has died in Dublin following a short illness.

item.title: CNNの政治コメンテーターで、米共和党の大統領選キャンペーンにも携わったベテラン政治アドバイザー、アリス・スチュワート氏が58歳で死去（CNN）
item.description:
CNN:
Alice Stewart, a CNN political commentator and veteran political adviser who worked on several GOP presidential campaigns, dies at 58  —  Alice Stewart, a veteran political adviser and CNN political commentator who worked on several GOP presidential campaigns, has died.  She was 58.

item.title: 英ニューズ・グループによる電話ハッキング事件の法廷証拠開示文書では、証拠隠滅の詳細が明らかになり、同社が政治情報を収集していたことが示されている（Rodney Tiffen/Inside Story）。
item.description:
Rodney Tiffen / Inside Story:
Court discovery docs from the UK's News Group phone hacking cases give more detail about evidence destruction and indicate the company gathered political intel  —  Fresh revelations suggest that the scandalous behaviour at London-based Murdoch newspapers was wider and deeper than previously believed

item.title: パスワード共有の取り締まりを成功に導き、現在はライブ番組への注力を推し進めるネットフリックスのグレッグ・ピーターズ共同CEOのプロフィール（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
A profile of Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters, who led the company's successful crackdown on password sharing and is now pushing a focus on live programming  —  Now all he's got to figure out is live programming, sports, gaming, pricing and, oh, advertising.  —  In mid-February, Greg Peters …

item.title: 情報筋：WBDはNBAと放映権保持について話し合いを続けているが、リーグがNBCユニバーサルと契約し、WBDがそれに応じざるを得なくなる可能性の方が高い（Alex Sherman/CNBC）
item.description:
Alex Sherman / CNBC:
Sources: WBD continues to hold talks with the NBA about keeping the rights, but it's more likely the league signs papers with NBCUniversal, forcing WBD to match  —  Whether it's two people in a marriage or a company and a sports league, it's not easy to break up a 40-year partnership.

item.title: AIが生成したニュースキャスターを使い、過激派のプロパガンダを迅速かつ安価に流している「ニュース・ハーベスト」と呼ばれるISIS系のメディア・プログラムの様子（Pranshu Verma/Washington Post）
item.description:
Pranshu Verma / Washington Post:
A look at an ISIS-affiliated media program called News Harvest, which is using AI-generated news anchors to disseminate extremist propaganda quickly and cheaply  —  The Islamic State-affiliated media broadcast News Harvest shows how artificial intelligence can be used to disseminate extremist propaganda quickly and cheaply.

item.title: 情報筋ソニーとApollo、NDAに署名するもパラマウント資産$26Bの買収提案から後退、ソニー株主のストリーミング費用への懸念も一因（New York Times）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Sony and Apollo sign NDAs but back away from their $26B offer for Paramount's assets, partly due to Sony shareholders' concerns over streaming costs  —  The two companies have expressed interest in acquiring the media conglomerate, but are backing away from their $26 billion all-cash offer.

item.title: 米国は、中国でCOVID-19を取材した後に投獄されたチャン・ツァンが、出所予定後に消息を絶ったという報道に深い懸念を抱いていると述べた（Hayley Wong/South China Morning Post）。
item.description:
Hayley Wong / South China Morning Post:
The US says it is deeply concerned over reports that Zhang Zhan, imprisoned after covering COVID-19 in China, has disappeared after her expected prison release  —  - Zhang Zhan, arrested in 2020 after reporting on coronavirus in Wuhan, has not been heard from since her expected prison release date, advocates say

item.title: CPJはメディアと市民団体の連合を率いて、ウィキリークス創設者ジュリアン・アサンジ氏に対する告訴を取り下げるよう米司法省に要請した。
item.description:
Committee to Protect Journalists:
The CPJ led a coalition of media and civic groups urging the US DOJ to drop charges against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange, who has a UK hearing on May 20  —  The Committee to Protect Journalists led a coalition of civil society organizations urging the United States Department of Justice …

item.title: Reddit、2023年に停止した表彰制度を再導入、代替のGolden Upvotes制度を終了、コントリビューター・プログラムを35カ国に拡大（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
Reddit reintroduces the awards system it shut down in 2023, ends the replacement Golden Upvotes system, and expands its Contributor Program to 35 countries  —  Reddit announced on Wednesday that it is reintroducing its awards system after shutting down the program last year.

item.title: ルーシー・レトビーの記事、英国における裁判記録の費用、事件に関する警察のドキュメンタリーなどについて、ニューヨーカー誌のジャーナリスト、レイチェル・アヴィヴとのQ&A（Sarah Scire/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Sarah Scire / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with New Yorker journalist Rachel Aviv on her Lucy Letby article, the cost of trial transcripts in the UK, the police documentary about the case, and more  —  “So much of the media coverage — and the trial itself — started at the point at which we've determined that [Lucy] …

item.title: ソースRokuの日曜朝のMLBパッケージは3年間で3000万ドルの価値があるが、MLBは広告からより多くの収入を得ることができる。
item.description:
Evan Drellich / New York Times:
Source: Roku's Sunday morning MLB package is worth $30M over three years, but the MLB can earn more from ads; Peacock paid $30M/year for the package before  —  Major League Baseball's Sunday morning package on Roku, called “Sunday Leadoff,” is worth a total of $30 million over three years …

item.title: シカゴ・トリビューン紙の黒人・女性記者7人が、白人・男性記者より低賃金であることを知りながら、オルデン社を相手取って連邦訴訟を起こした。
item.description:
Laura Wagner / Washington Post:
Seven Black and female Chicago Tribune journalists file a federal suit against Alden, claiming it has knowingly paid them less than White and male counterparts  —  It's the latest revolt by journalists at a newspaper owned by Alden Global Capital.  —  Chicago Tribune journalists filed suit Thursday …

item.title: 調査：アメリカ人の39％が、自分と同じ政治的見解を持つジャーナリストからニュースを得ることが少なくともある程度重要だと回答（Emily Tomasik/Pew Research Center）
item.description:
Emily Tomasik / Pew Research Center:
Survey: 39% of Americans say it is at least somewhat important that they get news from journalists who share their political views  —  Most Americans say it is not important that the news they get comes from journalists who share their political views, age, gender or other traits.

item.title: マイケル・コーエンがドナルド・トランプのNY裁判で記者との関係を証言、ジャーナリストと情報源の複雑な関係を示す（CNN's Reliable Sources）
item.description:
CNN's Reliable Sources:
Michael Cohen testifies about his ties to reporters during Donald Trump's NY trial, showing the complicated relationships journalists often have with sources  —  The Donald Trump hush money trial is dragging reporters into uncomfortable territory and laying bare the complicated relationships journalists often have with sources.
